alert.note: Alert for City of Roanoke; Roanoke (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 11 at 7:05PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Virginia, including the following county and independent city, City of Roanoke and Roanoke. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 705 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cook Creek, Carvin Creek, Buffalo Creek, Gum Spring Branch, Coyner Branch and Back Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Roanoke... Salem... Vinton... Roanoke Mountain... Cave Spring... Hollins... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
